gameobject — GameObjects¶

The gameobject module contains the unifying GameObject class that every element in the game is based on. If an object has a position in worldspace, or is drawn to the screen based on its position in worldspace, it extends this class. GameObject provides the base functionality for an object to exist in Perseus.

In future iterations, GameObject will include functionality for health.

class gameobject.GameObject(id, position[, sprite=None])¶
class gameobject.GameObject(id, position, boundingpoly, collider[, sprite=None])
class gameobject.GameObject(id, position, boundingpoly, type[, sprite=None])

Creates an empty GameObject shell that has a presence in worldspace.

GameObjects are identified to most systems by their id

GameObjects that participate in collision detection must declare a type (by default this behavior is disabled), or include a custom collider.

addGLObject(GLObject)¶

Ties a GLObject to this GameObject, which will be drawn at the position of the GameObject.

getRenderables()¶

If the GameObject has either a Sprite or a GLObject or both, this returns a list of all the renderable objects tied to it.

accelerate(acc)¶

Adds acceleration to the acceleration vector.

stopAcceleration()¶

Sets the acceleration vector to zero.

setVelocity(vel)¶

Erases the existing velocity vector and replaces it with vel.

getDirection()¶

Returns the direction the GameObject is currently facing. (Only important on the Player and NPCs)

getWorldSpacePosition()¶

Returns the worldspace position of the GameObject.

getVelocity()¶

Returns the velocity of the GameObject.

getBoundingPoly()¶

Returns the bounding polygon for this GameObject.

getCollider()¶

Returns the Collidable component for this GameObject

addVelocity(rel_vel)¶

Adds rel_vel to the velocity vector.

Note

This is distinct from accelerate() in that accelerate() is bound by game time. addVelocity() will instantaneously change the velocity of the GameObject. accelerate() will change the velocity over a period of 1 second. Not sure if both of these will be needed, but it’s nice to have both.

setFlags(flag_data)¶

Sets instance-specific flags for a particular GameObject. This will be expanded upon in later iterations.

update(dt)¶

acceleration * dt is added to velocity.

velocity * dt is added to position.

General purpose update method. Subclasses will extend this if they need to.
